text:
Working on keyboard shortcuts - the 2 most valuable things to add shortcuts for I think are the cache buster button and the debug button.

*What Keyboard Shortcut do you think makes sense to trigger the cache buster?* (All key combinations must include `ctrl/command`or `alt`)
*What Keyboard Shortcut do you think makes sense to trigger the Debug Mode?* (All key combinations must include `ctrl/command`or `alt`)
just reposting to prevent the link from getting lost. I realize it’s pinned but if you’re like me you rarely check the pinned posts
I think ctrl/cmd because you can one-hand it more easily
Maximum efficiency

<https://tenor.com/view/maximum-effort-effort-deadpool-gif-11452161>

Lol I can’t JUST have it be ctrl or command, those have to be INCLUDED so it has to be multiple keys.
As a possible suggestion: `command/ctrl+Shift+X` for buster
OOOO
so either ctrl/cmd or ctrl/alt
Maybe ctrl/alt then, that feels more natural I think.

lol can’t do that specific one that’s an OS level keyboard shortcut already “Combinations that involve Ctrl+Alt are not permitted in order to avoid conflicts with the AltGr key.”  sorry.
Just as an FYI once this feature is added you will be able to set the shortcut to something else. As most people will probably not edit their keyboard shortcuts I want to make sure the default is going to be convenient, and not be too obscure that people might be like “WHY!!!!?” for example - `command+shift+pageUp` is probably not a great shortcut because it either requires two hands or for you do do like a crippled hand keyboard smash
Hahahah
hmmm
So it can just be alt+something?
how about alt+tab, that feels right

lol you have a knack for finding shortcuts that are not permitted - “Tab key was removed from list of supported keys in Chrome version 33 and above for accessibility reasons.”

Basically everything involving accessibility revolves around hitting tab
Maybe something with the backslash and tilde buttons since they don’t get pressed very often.
but yes alt+most keys is totally fine
I’m out of thoughts after that/~

`alt+``
would work and `alt+\`
would also work
I think I like the alt+` idea
the tilde always makes me think coding or console stuff so I think that makes sense for the debug button
danmit. tilde is not allowed(OS limitation)

Supported keys: A-Z, 0-9, Comma, Period, Home, End, PageUp, PageDown, Space, Insert, Delete, Arrow keys (Up, Down, Left, Right) and the Media Keys (MediaNextTrack, MediaPlayPause, MediaPrevTrack, MediaStop).
We could throw that link in the channel description I guess

topic:
Install the chrome extension: <https://spin.d.pr/D2LmWX>
Want to contribute? Share feedback here in the slack, post issues in the github, and feel free to submit pull requests <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension>
text:
set the channel topic: Install the chrome extension: <https://spin.d.pr/D2LmWX>
Want to contribute? Share feedback here in the slack, post issues in the github, and feel free to submit pull requests <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension>
lol `alt+tab` is to change active app in Windows xD
:stuck_out_tongue:
maybe I am overthinking, but what about custom shortcuts (you can choose configuring it in the config page)
so each of us can choose, because tildes doesn't look like a good idea for me, different lang layout can make it more difficult to access
That’s already going to happen - anyone will be able to set custom keyboard shortcuts as well
then, I won't set any by default
and let the user choose it
we will avoid any issue then
The way Chrome handles extension’s keyboard shortcuts - we define a recommended shortcut basically that will act as the default, then users can override via the extensions - keyboard shortcuts screen
I don’t know if we can simply not provide a default - haven’t tried
New tagline: HubSpot Developer Extension - it’s like HubSpot and Google Chrome Netflixed and chilled.
